name: Ibis Laon

reviews.text: stayed for 3 nights while participating in annual classic car rally. all hotel guests also rally participants. rooms clean, general rooms rather small but we had disabled room as my husband has MS. plenty of space with enormous wet room. food adequate although did run out of several items during breakfast and dinner.
reviews.title: cheap and cheerful

reviews.text: safe car park, locked at night.
reviews.title: Does the job and staff are great
Great surprise
reviews.text: We decided to break up our return to Paris with a stop in Laon. What a treasure. The city was beautiful. Our hotel was also a surprise. We stay in Ibis hotels throughout Europe and this was one of the best. The room was larger than our airport hotel and the bed was very comfortable. Recommend it highly. Keep in mind it's not the Savoy an adjust your expectations accordingly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fly's in the room when we arrived, the bath was chipped and main problem was the window would not close properly allowing the traffic noise to come into the room. Also tiles were falling off the side of the bath.
reviews.title: Poor majntenance of hotel room
very good value
reviews.text: Yes, it's not a 5 star hotel, but it offers easy access by car, very friendly and efficient service, clean standard IBIS rooms and a decent restaurant for a seriously good price. We prefer to stay out of town to avoid traffic and navigation frustrations, so we put up with being in industrial areas. This one's got a car wash next to it and blocks of flats which is ok, and for venturing into Laon old town you could actually walk the back route and leave the car at the hotel. One of our "regulars" on our way through France, always giving us a good nights rest.

Booked eight Ibis hotels at one time. All took booking on credit card exept this one who phoned and said the card would not work and asked for another one. Found out later that first card would not let them charge us in Stirling and so they charged new one in Stirling at enhanced rate.
reviews.title: Book elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here twice and both times room was very small with no heatng.
reviews.title: Clean, cheap and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as a stop over on a trip to Italy. It's a bog standard Ibis hotel - straightforward, clean, compact and reasonably priced. It's located on the edge of town and it would be a stiff climb up to the old town and cathedral. We drove up (there's plenty of free parking at the Ramparts) and it's well worth doing so. The cathedral is very impressive and we had a fine meal in town. Breakfast was the usual Ibis buffet - no surprises, all fine. Staff were friendly. The hotel is easy to find with lots of parking for a small charge.
reviews.title: Fine for a stop over

reviews.text: Arrived mid afternoon and was given a room key for a room that had not yet been cleaned. Very poor meal indeed in restaurant. Really wish I had dined in Laon, but it is a stiff, very steeply uphill 25 minute walk from the Ibis to the town. I was also given a questionnaire about hotel car-park security. Was this a subtle way of telling me that there had been problems? Bathroom fittings were shabby. Shower hose was split. I have stayed many nights in Ibis hotels this year. This was the poorest, by some way.
reviews.title: Average
Over night stay
reviews.text: a good stop a couple of houres from calais, the resturant though is ok but the menu is a bit more limited than it used to be. the rooms are tipicle Ibis clean comfortable and compact. I have stayed here before and will stay again as it is a convenient stop on the return to england

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on our way South. Laon is a delightful town and worth a visit. The Ibis is outside of the ancient city, but we managed the uphill walk, despite hotel staff saying it would be too far and difficult. It was worth the climb. No restaurants near the hotel so on a Sunday evening hotel dining was necessary, however the meal was good value.
reviews.title: Stop over in Laon
Good - with the odd snag.
reviews.text: We checked in, but on arriving at our room, found the chambermaid (who didn't seem to understand French) still servicing the room.

reviews.title: OVERNIGHT STOP
reviews.text: Very handy place to stop on route through France, with garage nearby to fill up with petrol. Quite location and friendly helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to spend a night in Laon on our way home from Burgundy but there didn't seem to be a great choice of hotels. We hadn't stayed in an Ibis before, although we have used other Accor brands. We found the hotel quite easily - or at least the satnav did. The room was fine - everything one needs, decent bed, clean bathroom - without any frills, but for 46 Euros booked a few days in advance the value was excellent.
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is some way from the city centre - too far to walk on a March afternoon. However the reception staff gave us very clear directions to a free car park ideally situated in the centre, only a short drive away. We were a bit disappointed by the city, having seen it in the distance from the motorway many times - maybe our expectations were too high (and it was a cool Saturday afternoon in early March). The cathedral is superb though.
reviews.title: Ibis Laon

description: The Ibis Laon hotel is close to the centre of Laon, 3 km from historic town centre and its cathedral. A little further afield, visit the Caverne Du Dragon war museum (18 km) and the Center Parcs (15 km). Book one of our 72 airconditioned rooms with WiFi Internet (including 3 adapted for guests with limited mobility) and benefit from our amenities, 2 meeting rooms, a restaurant, bar, snacks 24hrs, a terrace area and secure private outdoor parking. Golf and tennis facilities are nearby.
